text: I told my professor how amazing it is you can just save code and continue with the new updated functions etc. She looked confused and said "but matlab also does that?" and then I was confused for a bit and struggled to explain what the difference is

elements.text: I told my professor how amazing it is you can just save code and continue with the new updated functions etc. She looked confused and said "but matlab also does that?" and then I was confused for a bit and struggled to explain what the difference is

text: matlab does also do that though, doesn’t it?

text: I think it just doesn't compile so it just always looks up functions again and again? Or something to that effect

text: Revise won't reload a currently running function, right?

elements.text: Revise won't reload a currently running function, right?

text: Uh, why not just use Python's stdlib `importlib.reload` ?

elements.text: Uh, why not just use Python's stdlib

text: `importlib.reload` also has other issues that make it impractical in some situations. (don't recall what they are at the moment !) ... the reload  can fail.
